game.info: Just look at these ginormous ears! Fluffy, AND they can discern precise sounds to avoid danger! They're so clever it hurts!
Ooh, this is a rare one! It's warm to the touch, like a little ball of sunshine! I bet this little guy just LOVES picnics!
These puppies have cute, beady little eyes that can pick out even the smallest of prey against a patch of brightmoss!
Barroth aren't the only ant-eaters in this desert! These guys love ants so much they'd even give Barroth a run for their money!
What a garish color for such a dark place! It just screams, "Danger! Do not touch! And don't put me ANYWHERE near your mouth!"
That shining tail! It's so pretty... I want to touch it... I want to be its best friend... *gasp* I almost fell for it!
Years of animal research and I've never seen a web being made! Even if you destroy a web, it just magically appears again the next day!
These budies just love rotten meat! If you were to drop dead in the Rotten Vale, you might even be their next meal!
These birds are always after large monsters' leftovers. If you spot one, a monster's probably lurking nearby!
Their perfectly round eyes and heart-shaped faces make them popular pets. You may have seen some in Astera, too!
These fellas roll dung around all day long. Need some dung? Then look no further! What you do with it is none of my business!
Is that an explosive rock it's rolling around!? It must have astounding thermal resistance! Let me just touch its legs to-- OUCH!
It stores paralyzing gas in its body and releases it when threatened! See? Here, in its soma-AGH! I...I can't...mooove...
It's developed organs that produce a sleep gas in order to survive in the Coral Highlands! When provoked it releases-ZZZZZZzzzzz...
This one stores explosive fluids! But don't worry, I've learned my lesson with toads, I won't touch this one... Uh...is it leaking...?
It wiggles in the wind and isn't blown away because it's anchored in to the ground! Let's have a look at its feet... URRGH! It's stuck...
This empress of the night only appears when there's a full moon! Let's see if she'll deign to show us her royal feet... URRGH! Nope...
They can lift incredible weights, and even made the Wildspires. They could probably even carry you! If you put down your huge weapon...
Authoritative expression... crown-like head and mantle-like wings... *gasp* A real emperor! F-Forgive us our impertinence!
Sometimes nature makes violent evolutions. BUT! To fully understand it, we must yet reach out a hand and... OUCH! I-It bit me!
Wow! It really DOES look like a helmet! And it's carrying...a Piercing Pod? Well, I'm sure it won't mind if I take-Ow!
They carry Slinger Thorns and march around in groups just like soldiers! Does that make thorns their rations? Do they...eat it? Ew...
That avant-garde shell design, that superb silhouette and color scheme... Forget research, I'm getting out my sketch book!
Wowzers, even Helmcrabs have gone gold! Is it holding... a Dragon Pod!? Guess when you gotta eat, you gotta eat!
This little one isn't too different from your regular Gold Helmcrab, but it's a lot shinier. Guess it hoarded more grub for itself?
Holy Hermitaurs! A shiny crab!? Looks like it'll drop something if you follow it. Wait, isn't this a piece of gold!? NICE!
Look at the shell on this thing! It makes me just wanna pick it up and scream "big gold haul coming through!"
These clever kiddos raise a ruckus when a large monster enters their territory. Just amazing, really. It's⁠—OK, SHUT UP ALREADY!
These cuties roll snowballs, but they aren't building snowmen. They're gathering crystals of ice into big crystalbursts. So talented!
Nothing beats a hot spring when it's cold! These monkeys get it. They also get minor heat stroke from staying in too long. Oof!
Whoa! A single gleaming golden monkey mixed in with the hot springs tour group! It's glittering! Dazzling! And...soft-boiled?
These glowy boys light up dark caves! They rock the creepy-cute thing, but I don't need to see a whole bunch wriggling at once...
Looking at these guys, I can hear their moms saying, "If you're cold, put on a jacket!" Hmm, does the hood come off? ...No. SORRY!
These guys eat the bugs that gather around nutritious nuts. So it's as if their arrow-shaped heads point straight to bug buffets!
These guys eat the bugs that gather around nutritious nuts. So it's as if their arrow-shaped heads point straight to bug buffets!
Oh my Wrog! This is THE quintessential ancestor of amphibians! Just as masterful in the water as on land... Magnificent!
These fish are found all over the New World, show of some amazing primitive biology, AND they're easy fishing even for beginners!
This fish is literally bursting with explosive chemicals! It hides in weedy shallows, but it'll run away if you wiggle your bait!
They're even burstier than regular Arowana, if you can believe it! They're sensitive to movement, so don't wiggle that bait!
They like to draw Flying Meduso to their light and... CHOMP! It'd definitely be worth staying up all night to watch them in action!
Its specialized pectoral fins allow it to skip on water! It can even GLIDE! You won't be catching this one with a fishing pole!
Previously known via fossils, this species was thought extinct. Finding otherwise was a real surprise.
They like to swim around in relatively deep water. Try wiggling the lure if it doesn't bite right away!
These big fish like to snatch away bait! Use the rod's flexibility to your benefit to bring it in, and be sure to check it for items!
I knew that these are known to approach the shore in search of prey, but great job catching it! And not losing your pole in the process!
Golden-scaled cave-dwellers, they'll hightail it if you wiggle your bait! They also like to nibble before taking a real bite, so don't get duped!
Platinum-scaled cave-dwellers, they'll hightail it if you wiggle your bait! You're going to need a lot of patience if you want to catch one.
Small cave-dwelling fish with precious scales, they'll try to psych you out with a nibble, so be patient - and don't wiggle your bait!
These fish are useful in restorative items for their high nutritional value! Just wiggle your bait in some deep water, or blast them out!
Watchout - Their bodies contain the same substances as Devil's Blight! They're hard to spot, but they react noticeably to moving bait.
These fish have transparent scales, so you can see their skeleton and organs. They only live in cold environments.
These beauties lurk at the bottom, save when surfacing to feed by night. They're so rare, they're said to be familiars of the sea god.
It's so pretty I'd mistaken it for a flower! The scales reflect the light into such a deep blue that it can only be called a miracle!
These magnificent wings! Their rainbow glow is so alluring... I...I can't tear my eyes away from it! What a masterpiece!
See those glowing bellies? Usually they're yellow, but they turn red near big monsters...W-Why are they glowing red near me!?
They only emerge on rainy days, and it's said that the day after is guaranteed to be sunny! They're like good weather charms!
Upon inspection, these seem to have scales. And claws...and fangs! Great Gravios! They're mini-wyverns! I've made a huge discovery!
These scales reflect the light so perfectly, they look like pure gold! I thought Scalebats only liked the dark, but these babies wanted to shine!
Look! A female Coralbird! They can hover silently in the air, and they can eat coral! What superbly adapted creatures!
Coralbirds only allow one chosen male into their flock. In other words, this guy's the top dog- or bird.... You know what I mean!
The fluid that it collects in this sac here is...that's right, Vitalily nectar! Its healing properties should be useful in a pinch.
An insect that collects a restorative nectar and stores it in a sac. When struck, the sac releases a healing mist that's sure to be useful for hunters in a pinch.
Its nectar has stronger healing properties than average, and it even releases a healing mist when its sac is ruptured!
Seeing Flying Meduso is a dead give-away that there's a wind current nearby! Find it, and YOU too can fly like the wind!
Wow, this puppy's BRIGHT! Even a large monster would be stunned by it, I'm sure. It's like a living Flash Bomb...with wings!

Winged insects that emit a bright light when struck. To survive, Flashflies live together in a swarm and have a defense mechanism that allows them to emit a blinding flash if threatened, giving them time to flee to safety. The flash is so bright that it's possible to cause a large monster to flinch. Once the threat has disappeared the swarm will gather together again.
Be gentle with this fella. GENTLE! If you hit it with even ONE shot from your slinger, it'll come careening down to the ground.
They stay in caves during the day, but come out to feed at night. If you see a bunch of them, keep an eye out for a rare guest!
Serrated teeth, and those remiges... So much in common with prehistoric birds that it's a veritable living fossil!
I'm so excited my hands are shaking... Its red crown...and that blue plumage! To think it was in the Ancient Forest all along!
Only seven of these are said to exist in the entire forest! To think that I'd ever see one in my lifetime... I'm... *sob* I'M SO HAPPY!
The Bringer of Light? The Bug of Brilliant Gold? I...I'm speechless! My...my heart feels like it's been dipped in golden bliss!
This is the... I... How in the WORLD did you manage to... Ooh, the colors... One, two... four... It's blinding me with rainbow colors!
Shhh, quiet now! Hear that beautiful song? It's meant as a mating call to the males, and who wouldn't fall for a voice like that?
You caught a Downy Crake!? They've been seen on the backs of monsters before, but you're the first person EVER to catch one!
Great jumping Jagras! A Bristly Crake!? The fleet-footed bird of legend...right before my very eyes! Someone pinch me...
Ahh, look at those tentacles! I always wanted to count them for myself! OK OK, one...two...three⁠—Hey, quit moving! One...two..
It's one of the cute critters from Eorzea! I tried to pet it, but this little guy's got thorns - a thousand of them! I'll be tweezing for weeks...
It's one of the cute critters from Eorzea! It's kinda like a cactus, uh, if a cactus had legs and could run at mach speed...
Don't be fooled by the sleepy face on these critters! Some say they're the ones who shaped the landscape of the Guiding Lands.
This one's all covered in moss! Must be pretty healthy, too, since it's sprouted flowers. Let's touch it! ...Oh. Weird...
Aww, look! It's got a little helmet on! Safety first, eh? Hahaha! Ahem. Anyway, these Moly are the best at digging!
Oh... oh my gosh... It's so... so. SOFT!  It's like a fluffy pink cloud!  C-Can I keep it and use it as a pillow?  Please?
This black-spiked Moly evolved to see through effluvium with its bright golden eyes. Quite the VISIONARY, don't you think? Heheh.
The white fur on this Moly isn't just warm and fluffy, it serves as camouflage in the snow, too! Ooh... it's so chubby and cute!
The fiery red fur on this Moly makes it look like a tough guy, but all it wants is to be tickled on its belly. See? Coochy coochy coo!
Jeepers, talk about strange with a capital S. Its elastic body, and odd skin... I think I've heard fairy tales about this thing before...
I wonder if what the Witcher said was true... Do Nekkers really grow vicious when in a swarm? I think there's a place where we can test this...

A small bird that glows a faint red. This glow comes from pollen that accumulates on its body while drinking nectar. Many mistake this glow for a human soul, hence the name. Petalaces become fragrant and gain an attack boost when imbued with this pollen.

A small bird that glows a faint green. This glow comes from pollen that accumulates on its body while drinking nectar. Many mistake this glow for a human soul, hence the name. Petalaces become fragrant and gain an attack boost when imbued with this pollen.

A small bird that glows a faint yellow. This glow comes from pollen that accumulates on its body while drinking nectar. Many mistake this glow for a human soul, hence the name. Petalaces become fragrant and gain an attack boost when imbued with this pollen.

A pheasant with a giant red vocal sac. It sounds like a crying child, which it uses to attract large monsters that will, in turn, distract its predators. Hunters capture and use Wailnards to lure large monsters to their vicinity. It is a usually docile creature that spends most of its time in hiding. Despite its wings, it's not very good at flying.

A beetle native to the Kamura area. The term Wirebug generally refers to the females of the species. It is capable of producing a super-strong silk colloquially known as Ironsilk, which it uses to carry materials to build its nest. For ages, the villagers of Kamura have trained Wirebugs to make use of their mobility. It's skittish when feral, but quite obedient once trained. Loves Jewel Lilies.

A butterfly with long wings. In flight, it looks like a flowing piece of cloth, giving it its name. When struck, it scatters a dust cloud and flees. The dust has a tightening effect on human skin making it more resistant to injury.

A butterfly with crimson wings. In flight, they look like dancing flames and in the past, were often mistaken for fire or ghosts. When attacked, they release a type of dust before fleeing. This dust can temporarily boost attack strength if inhaled.

A butterfly with spotted yellow wings that can be found living in swarms in various locales across the region. In the past they were mistaken for flying eyeballs hence their creepy name. When attacked, they release a type of dust before fleeing. This dust can temporarily boost stamina if inhaled.

A dragonfly with a sharp red tail that releases pheromones when under threat. During mating season, it rubs its tail on various surfaces to spread the chemical secretion. This action often cuts through fishing nets. As a result, Cutterflies are shrouded in superstition, particularly amongst fishermen. Breathing in the pheromone grants hunters increased concentration for a higher chance at critical hits.

A beetle native to the Kamura area. This name refers to male Wirebugs, so called for their larger, more powerful bodies. As they are stronger than female Wirebugs, they are often used for long- distance movement, though they are less nimble and harder to control. They are also far less common than females. Once placed in a patch of Jewel Lilies, it'll never leave.

A golden beetle. When in flight, the sound of its wings flapping has a relaxing effect. Its diet mostly consists of other tiny insects. The ones that it favors most can be found on the plants that Petalaces are made from. Hunters wearing a Petalace will attract Golden Spiribugs and often return from hunts with their Petalace covered in them. A dye made from this bug is a famous specialty of Kamura Village.

A gold beetle related to Golen Spiritbugs. The sound of its wings flapping has a relaxing effect. Its diet mostly consists of other tiny insects that feed on the plants that Petalaces are made from. Hunters wearing a Petalace will attract Gilded Spiritbugs and often return from hunts with their Petalace covered in them. A dye made from this bug is a famous specialty of Kamura Village.
